content.question: Which of the following best explains why Frederick Douglass famously became “the most photographed man in the nineteenth century”?

choices.label: He was a rare example of an African American leader who became famous despite remaining enslaved.
He was the first African American ambassador to represent the United States in a non-African country.
He became an influential and celebrated abolitionist and a symbol of what African Americans could achieve if they had freedom.
He was the first African American leader to argue that slavery was incompatible with the principles of the United States Constitution.

content.answer: He became an influential and celebrated abolitionist and a symbol of what African Americans could achieve if they had freedom.
